definitions.definition: make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred; dedicate formally to a religious or divine purpose.
examples: the present Holy Trinity church was consecrated in 1845

definitions.definition: (in Christian belief) make (bread or wine) into the body or blood of Christ.
examples: they received the host but not the consecrated wine

definitions.definition: ordain (someone) to a sacred office, typically that of bishop.
examples: in 1969 he was consecrated bishop of Northern Uganda
synonyms: ordain; formalhallow "the bishop had consecrated two cathedrals in his time"

definitions.definition: devote (something) exclusively to a particular purpose.
examples: they'd decided to consecrate all their energies to this purposeful act
synonyms: ordain; formalhallow "the bishop had consecrated two cathedrals in his time"
